title: Restore normal system cursor across React app and standalone landing page

requirements.summary: Remove the React app custom flame-sword cursor overlay and restore normal system cursor behavior across all routes.
acceptanceCriteria: `CustomCursor` is no longer rendered in the global React layout (no custom cursor overlay elements are mounted).
Global CSS no longer forces `cursor: none` for desktop devices; standard cursor behavior is restored (e.g., pointer cursor on links/buttons).
No cursor-follow animation runs on mousemove in the React app, and there are no leftover visual artifacts (ring/glow) on any page.

file_operations.description: Remove the global CustomCursor import and rendering from the Layout so no custom cursor overlay mounts on any route.
Remove the global custom cursor CSS block (including any `cursor: none !important` rules and `.custom-cursor-*` styles) to restore default system cursor and pointer behavior.
Delete the CustomCursor component to prevent accidental reintroduction and ensure no overlay elements can be mounted.
Delete the custom cursor hook to ensure no mousemove-driven animation logic remains in the React app.

requirements.summary: Remove the standalone landing page custom cursor CSS/JS while preserving existing standalone interactions.
acceptanceCriteria: Standalone CSS no longer forces `cursor: none` and no longer defines/depends on `.custom-cursor-dot` / `.custom-cursor-ring` for cursor behavior.
Standalone JS no longer creates or animates custom cursor elements (the `initCustomCursor()` behavior is removed/disabled).
Mobile menu toggle, FAQ accordion, smooth scrolling, and contact-form success state continue to work when opening `frontend/static/growwithtutor-standalone/index.html` directly in a browser.

file_operations.description: Remove the standalone custom cursor styling section (including `cursor: none !important` and `.custom-cursor-dot` / `.custom-cursor-ring` rules) so the system cursor is used.

Remove/disable `initCustomCursor()` (and its initialization call) so no custom cursor elements are created/animated, while keeping smooth scrolling, mobile menu, FAQ accordion, and contact form success behavior unchanged.
